review.reviewBody: I was so hoping these pants would work for me because I love the way they look and the functionality of all the details. Unfortunately they are a size big for me. Im 53 and usually wear a size 24, 2, or XS, but I would need an XXS to feel comfortable wearing these on the slopes.
review.name: So good but runs big

review.reviewBody: M fits my leg perfectly, Im 510. Waist is a bit big but a belt can fix it.
review.name: Nice pants for long legs

review.reviewBody: I want to love these, but they are weirdly tight around the thighs. I exchanged them a few times, but had to choose between tight around the thighs or loose around the hips. May depend on how athletic you are (aka leg day), but I found the sizing challenging. They are snug around the thighs and I'm just hoping I can move adequately come winter.
review.name: Cute and functional but weird fit

review.reviewBody: I am a 12 in everything and ordered a large as the size chart says 12-14 for a large. It was too tight. I have to return for a xl which size chart says is a 16.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: So I have trouble finding pants that fit since I have larger legs but a small frame. These pants are excellent! My jean size is an 8 and these pants fit wonderfully. Highly recommend!
review.name: Nice fit for larger legs

review.reviewBody: Super cute and flattering, but I would order an xsmall next time
review.name: Runs large

review.reviewBody: I am 5'9" and weigh 155.  I got a size Large and they were too large.
review.name: Burton Vida Pant - Women's

name: Vida Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: These were the wrong shoes for me. They have a soft heel and a ton of arch support. If you have a heel-biased midfoot strike or heel strike, your arch breaks over the support foam and becomes very uncomfortable after only a couple miles. It felt like the beginnings of shin splints, which I've never had in any other shoe. I would only recommend these for midfoot and forward strikers. On the plus side, the middle part of the upper hugs the foot nicely, but I wouldn't recommend them for wide feet. The toe box is wider than brands like Asics, which I also appreciated. Not sure if it would be wide enough for people who normally wear wide sizes though. Wish I could return them, but 3 miles outside probably prevents that.
review.name: Good if you need lots of arch support

name: Pursuit Ride Running Shoe - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Ice Maiden II Lace Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ive been wearing these for 5 years. I finally replaced them with the same exact pair. I wear these things every. Single. Day. They have survived extreme amounts of paint and wood being dropped on them. I leave in upstate New York, and they handle the snow and ice amazingly. They also keep my feet warm. Favorite pair of shoes Ive ever owned.
review.name: Favorite Boots

review.itemreviewed: Ice Maiden II Lace Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Absolutely no support or insulation.  They are also too small.  Hate them
review.name: Horrible
comment: We are sorry that your experience did not meet your expectations. We take all feedback seriously and will do our best to improve the product in the future.

review.itemreviewed: Ice Maiden II Lace Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this boots. Been wearing this to work for a week now and its just perfect for me so far. I work in a cold room, with wet floors and cold conditions (34 degrees Fahrenheit). Ive tried every work boots available in the market but didnt work for me until I came across this one. I love how this boots is not too heavy. Its comfortable and keeps my feet warm. Its also waterproof so its a plus. The style is not so bad either. The fit is very on point and the price is pretty reasonable. Will definitely buy another pair.
review.name: Great Boots

review.itemreviewed: Ice Maiden II Lace Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I needed a rugged boot that I can quickly pull on over bare feet in the morning and take my dogs out.  Our pasture is frequently muddy or snowy and has a lot of cactus.  These have good padding and insulation and a thick sole, I expect to use daily for 7-8 months of the year.  The outside fabric wipes easily.  Rubber boots don't have much support and crack after a few months, while muck boots are too tall for pant legs to easily fit into.  The boots are great!
review.name: Highly functional and cute too

review.itemreviewed: Ice Maiden II Lace Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This was a gift for my wife. She wears size 9 and they fit great but a little bit wide..she says these are nice comfy and very warm boots!  they have a great outsole for wet conditions
review.name: My wife loves them!

review.itemreviewed: Ice Maiden II Lace Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my second purchase .I like that.very nice , comfortable, stylish and fit. that's perfect and keep my feet warm on cold winter in New York.
review.name: Warm and comfy

hasVariant.name: Infuse BOA Snowboard Boot - 2023 - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vans Infuse BOA Snowboard Boot - 2023 - Men's online or shop all Snowboard from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
The removable tongue inserts are a neat innovation.    I left Them out the first few days because Im used to a very soft boot with a traditional single boa.  I added Them back in for a little more support.   . Ive gone with the encore(much softer out of the box )  from vans for years.   I strayed And went with another boot company for a few seasons .  I decided to pull the trigger on these with out any input from reviews or other riders.        I enjoy being able to dial in even more flexibility and customize heel fit with the hybrid of laces , boa and strap.    I never wanted to go back to laces but they are a great quick addition.  Very comfortable right out the box . For me , no need to size much differently.     11.5 -12 is what I wear in vans so I went with 11.5   Toe box is wide and roomy for me , but not cold or so big that I wiggle out .    These are definitely well built especially for price.  Ive been in the low end entry model of boots for years cause  even though I ride 50-70 days a year I felt Id destroy even expensive boots .     Ill come back at the end of the season and either edit this or do a follow up.          

One draw back I see so far besides a little extra time and effort with the lace and power  strap vs just a boa  Breaking them in you might want to snag yourself a butler or maybe its time to have kids so you can make them pull these boots from your foot.    King Arthur is gonna need to  help you remove these boots from
The stone that is your feet. ..   but it does get easier.  .  9/10 best small innovations on a boot
That wont change
Your style but enhance it
review.name: Flex from

review.reviewBody:
Just got these in the mail and My Oh My am I stoked on them! Not only do they look incredible (Longo Green) but they also feel broken in right out of the box. Immediately had to throw them on and strap in right in my living room. The board feel is proper and I really dont want to take them off. These things are more comfortable than boots i've ridden 10 + days in. 

For sizing my shoe size varies between11-12 depending on the shoe, went with 11.5 and the fit is spot on. Toes are snug against the end but don't feel crammed at all. 

Price point is a little tough but you are definitely getting what you pay for. The attention to detail and quality on these bad boys is unmatched by other boots iv'e ridden. Overall I highly recommend. Yewwww
review.name: Feel as good as they look

name: Infuse BOA Snowboard Boot - 2023 - Men's

review.name: Comfy Boots

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love love LOVE my shoe! However One of the agents informed me that it should be true to size and unfortunately that is not for me.  My toe/foot hurts so badly after I wear them Id exchange, but I have already worn them a ton to see if they would stretch but, no no stretching that has helped.  And, now they are beyond me sending them for exchange.  So, even though they hurt, I still wear because I just love the design.  My recommendation for this insane cuteness is to definitely get .5 size up than normal size.  The toe box has a membrane on it that keeps the toe box really tight.  
The colors on the shoe are vibrant and stay that way.  I just love the two tone color palette that Merrell did.  As far as the waterproofing so far, my feet have gotten wet every time.  So, I would not give my waterproof vote. 
I really wish I could give 5 stars, because I would.  But, with the sizing, the hurt, and that it is not waterproof, then I have to give it 4.
review.name: Super Love but Need 1/2 Size Up!

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these for a camping/hiking trip in fall 2024. They worked perfectly for all the activities I got them for (16km hike with 800m elevation gain, bushwhacking, shorter trail walking etc). Since they're waterproof and have good grip I've kept them out for the winter as an everyday winter boot and they've also been excellent for that (tested for a month now in -25C weather and 15cm snow). They're warm and aren't letting any moisture through (despite stepping in a few deep, slushy puddles on warmer days). I also like that I can use different sock thicknesses dependent on the activity/weather and I don't have any rubbing/hotspots around my heel or toes like I often do in other shoes.
Absolutely worth every penny I spent.
review.name: Great all around

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable right out of the box!  Incredibly lightweight.  The arch support was perfect for my plantar fascitis, didn't need my usual inserts.  Matched the reviews I had read, I did size up half size and fit was perfect.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I really wanted to like these shoes, the tread on the bottom was good, waterproof, liked the color/pattern, mid height, but even though I bought a 1/2 size larger, my right big toe really be came sore in these shoes. I have other Merrill's that I love.
review.name: Problem with the fit.

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these boots; own them in black, lichen and blue. Wear them  almost everyday. Am retired and have foot issues. Live in Wyoming and walk about 3 miles a day for exercise. These boots have traction, support, cushioning and are waterproof. Also own these in the low version. Wear a size 10 1/2 but ordered size 11. Fit great, highly recommend.
review.name: Love my Antoras

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable and perfect for every day hiking. Highly recommend
review.name: Great boot

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Tested in wicklow, Ireland today, and my socks are dry!
review.name: Dry  here in Ireland!

review.itemreviewed: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very light and comfortable from the first day. Kept feet dry walking/running through wet grass. Havent tested in rain yet. Good grip for off-roading. Lining provides some extra warmth. Perfect fall runner for long hikes with my dog.
review.name: Great fall running shoe

name: Antora 3 Mid Waterproof Hiking Boot - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the SDG Components Tellis Dropper Seatpost online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This dropper came stock on my Santa Cruz, but it never performed great. The rise is pretty smooth but the dropping motion is slow, almost delayed. I swapped out the remote and increased cable tension hoping for better results, but the drop is still lagging. A brand new dropper should function better than this.
review.name: Theres better droppers out there.

review.reviewBody: I have the SDG Tellis on both my Santa Cruz FS bike and my steel hardtail.  They both were easy to install and work great.  They have been much more reliable than my precious hydraulic post, I have had zero issues with either Tellis that I ride.
review.name: SOLID AND RELIABLE DROPPER POST

review.reviewBody: So this post came on my Santa Cruz 5010 and at first I was skeptical because I have always used a Fox Transfer. But after a year of riding (in Texas so mud really isn't ever an issue) this thing is definitely holding up its end of the bargain. The actuation is smooth and reliable. The lever feels great. And, unlike the Transfer, this post has no, and I mean absolutely no, head wobble. Just for reference, I'm a lighter rider at 160lbs but I still put my bike (and this post) through its paces. I like it better than the Fox and although I've never ridden one, I've just read that Reverbs aren't very reliable. Take that as you will. Bottom Line: This is great post.
review.name: This is a great dropper!

review.reviewBody: The only thing worse than the quality of this post is the way I was treated by the company. This post came on my new Santa Cruz Tallboy. Everything else about this bike is awesome. This seatpost is not. First the lever failed and I replaced it with a Loam lever (much better upgrade). Within 3 months of owning the sdg the whole post failed and would not go up. The company refused to do anything about it despite an advertised 2 year warranty. They made me pay to ship it to them. Made me pay for the part that failed and made me pay to have it sent back. With all the shipping and replacement parts I spent enough to buy a quality post from a well know company. Skip the headache and just buy a better post
review.name: DONT BUY THIS POST

review.reviewBody: I purchased this for a temporary replacement for my Fox transfer post while out for service. I performed adequately but was not as smooth and responsive as the Fox. I put about 950 miles of trail riding on it working it pretty hard . It seemed I need to give it a bit if a butt bounce to drop it where the Fox drops smoothly.
review.name: Not bad but ...not great either.

review.reviewBody: I purchased 2 and installed one on my wife and I's bikes. These have been fantastic dropper posts that made our old rigid posts feel so horrible and like we were riding in a whole new world. I could not recommend this enough. Its sturdy, had no issues going up or down, and have been working for the 2 months they have been installed with no issues.
review.name: Easy to install, easy to use!

name: Tellis Dropper Seatpost

review.reviewBody: Spent many hours trying to activate the unit using all of the apps that are required. Finally got it to function but totally unable to update the firmware. I?m on a Mac and one app that is required in the process is not available in the Mac App Store. Only for iPhone or iPad. There may be a way around this but I?m not willing to go through the effort involved in getting this thing to work. I tried Stages Support. Their reply window is 4 to 6 days. Then they sent me a copy of the installation instructions that I already had said did not work. Not much support.
review.name: Dash l50

review.reviewBody: I went from a Gramin 1000 to a Wahoo Bolt and enjoyed the Bolt alot. However, the screen is too small and hard to read and I needed something that I could see better.  Setup on the website and app takes a little getting used to, but once you figure it out, it's incredibly powerful.  The Stages platform is great, the course creation tool works well, and the workout portion of the app / dash are better than anything out there.  Don't be afraid to make the switch to Stages.  Worked out well for me!
review.name: Great alternative to Wahoo Bolt

name: Dash L50 GPS Bike Computer

review.reviewBody: looking for a solid solution for a tarp and wing in all, at least severe weather conditions, I found these pegs. Works fine, even excellent, during strong ( up to 7 Bft ), and very strong winds ( 7+ ). One thing though: it can snap some guy-lines and/or tear up the fabric of the tarp due to the fact that the pegs simply hold out. They sit tight in all most every ground, and once the wind catches, they will hold on.

review.reviewBody: These are the best lightweight tent stakes we've ever used.  They drive in easily and are long enough to be very secure in most ground types.  The also come out easily when pulled from the correct angle.   Great stakes!

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a multi day trip with gravel bar overnights on the Current River. In the past used the basic stakes that came with my tent with less than optimal results. These hammer in the gravel, rocks and sand very easily, with a twisting motion as they anchor. Held the tent and rain fly extremely well and removal was no fuss in the morning.

review.reviewBody: They hold your tent down in storms, I tested it. Other tents were flying away. I used them for the guy lines. I was not able to find any better ones, except really heavy steel military surplus stakes. But these are still light weight. I will get these for all my tents.

review.reviewBody: I live in NH and am currently wearing my second pair of Icebug boots. Our niece in Colorado had surgery and told me that she was afraid to go outside for fear of falling on the ice. I ordered these for her and love the color combination. Despite being later in the season she's had plenty of opportunity to wear them, feels safe and LOVES them!
review.name: Icebug Metro2 BUGrip Women's Boots

review.reviewBody: I purchased these boots when Jackson Hole experienced the largest snowfall in years, and thankfully I was able to walk around and get the needed grip
review.name: Saved me in the Wyoming Super Snow Storm

review.reviewBody: After moving to NH from the mid Atlantic in December and within 2 weeks falling flat on my face on the ice (badly hurting myself, blood everywhere!), I went on a serious hunt for boots will real traction. IceBugs with their metal spikes are the real deal. It seems almost impossible to slip with these on. Now the downside is you cannot walk around indoors, youll slip on tile indoors or wreck your hardwood floors, but for the outdoors these are THE ONES.
review.name: Lifesavers

review.reviewBody:
I had never used Icebug products before, however, I have been able to test out these Metro 2 BUGrip boots in "devil mud", uneven ground, everyday wear, and on the recent ice we had in Texas and they are some of the most amazing boots I have had! We get what I call "devil mud" which is basically a mixture of clay and dirt that gets insanely slick when it gets wet. I was stoked to try these boots out since they have carbide-tipped studs, and let me tell you. They did not disappoint. The held up to every slick surface I put them on, the only thing I would recommend against is trying to walk across sheet metal that has ice on it, as these boots didn't have quite the right type of grip for that. After several days worth of rain I was also able to test their waterproofness in the new "ponds" I all of a sudden had at my house and they handled amazingly! The only downside is that if you plan on standing water nearly up to the tops of these boots for a long time, they can seep a tiny bit around the zipper from what I noticed, however, it was hardly enough to even make my sock damp. The only real "cons" would be that the sound of those studs can get super annoying if you have to run around indoors and if you have larger calves, I definitely recommend wearing tall socks to keep a bit of a buffer between the boots and your skin since they can rub a little bit sometimes. 

All in all, while these boots have a couple of minor annoyances, they are incredible and I will ABSOLUTELY be using them throughout this winter season as my go-to boots! #BackcountryGearhead
review.name: LOVE these boots!

name: Metro 2 BUGrip Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: If you are adding the NV 2.0 add on, I suggest you not buy this rack if you have average MTB frames with average handlebar widths, and plan to carry 4 bikes. The problem is the handlebars of opposing bikes (1 and 3, 2 and 4) will rub and potentially damage your equipment. This is clearly an engineering flaw, and the primary reason Kuat introduced the Piston series, which has tiered trays to remedy the issue (a design obviously borrowed from One-Up). If you carry only two or 3 bikes, not a problem. However, 4 will be. Get the Piston version if you plan to carry 4 bikes. Otherwise, be prepared to play "bike Rubik's cube" to see which ones will rub (or not) and packing towels in between handlebars. Ridiculous.
review.name: WARNING: Opposing MTBs rub.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Jetforce Pro 25L Backpack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: After a few years, I had to send the product in for repair and they told me that the battery could not be replaced and they would offer me a 15% discount on my next purchase. Not exactly what I would have expected for a quality product
review.name: Jetforce

review.reviewBody: The Jetforce is the best avalanche airbag. So glad it deflates a few minutes after it inflates. This would help you gain air space if you were buried in an avalanche.
review.name: Jetforce

review.reviewBody: Pack is well built and I love the ability to make the pack larger or smaller based on the objective and length of trip.
review.name: Durable and Versatile Pack

review.reviewBody: With this backpack now I feel very safe, I can carry everything I need and it looks very good with my jacket, for me it's a 10/10
review.name: Secure, comfortable and elegant

review.reviewBody: Love the airbag and the technology. Easy to charge, turn on and off. Practiced deploying and repacking before our backcountry trip to Japan. Worked great and is easy to repack after deployment. Did not feel like the 25L was big enough for cold weather touring. Will for sure be buying the 35L attachment. Had a hard time fitting in the insulated layer with extra gloves and a repair kit. Had no room for anything else. I like the compartment inside for water, it held a 2 liter Nalgene and a "bullet" type thermos easily and nicely. Struggled with the waist belt closure, especially with gloves on. Used it 6 days straight and finally started getting it, but it never came easily. Understand why it has to be the way it is, if you need to deploy the pack in an avalanche, it would definitely hold, but it makes for extended transitions trying to orient it and tighten it properly. Also, one of the helmet "bikini" plastic hooks broke the first day. Had to use a wire tie for the rest of the trip, these should be metal.
review.name: Overall great airbag

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag to be my sole BC ski pack and it has proven to accomplish this. From a safety perspective the electric fan inflatable airbag is great especially because I can practice multiple inflations to be prepared. The dedicated avalanche tool pocket is key along with the smaller essentials pocket next to it. I purchased the 25L and quickly realized that for my tour gear I like to take, it is small. But of course I can purchase the add ons pack extenders, but I might have purchased the 35L for that reason. I was also impressed by the weight for a fan airbag pack.
review.name: Solid Airbag/BC Pack

review.reviewBody:
I've had this bag for over five years. I've used this bag for every backcountry trip, from heli trips in Alaska, multi-day hut to hut ski touring in the Alps, to single day trips in the side country. Overall, I like this bag a lot save for two issues, one of which others have touched on.
Pros: Battery system is great, app is easy to use and update the software, lights are easy to read. Multiple uses each charge is great. 
- Avy bag is easy to pack back down and get back in the compartment. 
- I love the modularity between the sizes: 10L is perfect for heli or sidecountry, 25L is good for a full day or maybe two. The 35L is great for multi-day trips or it can get you to the hut, and then you can switch to the 10 or 25L to do day strikes from the hut. 
- Has enough features and room to organize essentials and the avy trigger is conveniently located. 
Cons: THE ZIPPER...I always have to check this thing while touring or before I go downhill. If it is packed full, this zipper WILL come undone, just hopefully not to a great extent. Maybe they've fixed this with newer models. I recognize that this zipper can't be bomber so that the bag inflates, but there should be some sweet spot where the bag has freedom to deploy without the zipper coming undone at the slightest disturbance. 
- If you are bringing everything you need for self-sustained, multi-day guiding or camping (tents, stove, sleeping bag, etc.), none of these booster sizes will be enough for you.
- No route for water or radio, you will have to rig something up yourself.
Recommendations: #1, the zipper
#2: Some cinch straps that can accommodate each booster would be great. Sometimes you take a 25L but don't completely fill it up. I want my pack to be tight and condense on my back when I'm skiing and being able to cinch this pack down as small as possible would be great.
Overall, this is great avy technology and the boosters let you pick how big you want it to be for each excursion. It's a great pack and I love Black Diamond. If they can fix those two issues (zipper, cinch straps), this pack would be the BEST.
review.name: Great Avy Bag, One Really Bad Flaw

review.reviewBody: I have been borrowing my husband's pack for years, so it was time to get my own and this one fits perfectly on my petite frame. It seems like it is well designed to fit all my gear. I'm excited to wear it the backcountry this winter.
review.name: Fits well on a smaller frame

review.reviewBody: Construction is excellent but the purported 25L volume does not seem close to 25L actual volume. I would order the 35L add on if I could get the website to work (which it doesnt and Ive gotten no response by writing to Black Diamond).
review.name: Well made bag, too small

review.reviewBody: The features of this bag are great. No argument with other reviews on that front. Unfortunately whatever material it is made of has marked up every jacket that I've worn underneath it. My expensive gortex shell has large black marks everywhere that this bag has touched the jacket.
review.name: Solid bag but it marks up any clothing that touches it

name: Jetforce Pro 25L Backpack

review.reviewBody: I  going to return them once Canada post start working again

review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes because I had a pair similar to these awhile back that I love to death so I was excited to see they had something similar still in stock. But unfortunately I do not like these styles nearly as much. They have an annoyed neoprene cuff around the ankle so trying to put them on with ankle socks forces the sock to bunch up and they arent all that comfortable with ankle socks either. I do not wear crew socks so it bummed me out that these are not like normal shoes and now I seldom, if ever wear them. So bummed they changed the design or made their most colorful shoes like this one. Dang!
review.name: Loved the older version so much more!!!

review.reviewBody: Available in a cheery orange with tread that offers good grip and stability. Since there is no tongue, your foot slides in and is hugged around the arch. The toe box is rounded with room to wiggle your toes. The insole is removable to accommodate orthotics. I wear an 11 and this shoe does not make my feet look big, is comfortable and fun!
review.name: Comfortable Fun

hasVariant.name: Strip Drive 300 Plus Tail Light
hasVariant.description: Buy the Lezyne Strip Drive 300 Plus Tail Light online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Lezyne's motto is "Engineered Design", which I have to say, given the products of theirs I've tested is just word salad: a couple words tossed together to lead people to think that they're doing something special and thus, justify their high prices.

Spoiler: They fail at the "design" part, which means... they're just charging more money.

Case in point here: 300lumen blinky light for the back of the bike. 
Bright? Sure.
Multiple modes? Yep.
Battery life? Pretty good - corresponds to how bright and how often the light is on / blinking. 

Design: [sad trombone]
Apparently, the "engineers" who "design" things at Lezyne forgot to take a look at a bike and make note of the fact that where this light is to be mounted (seatpost or seat-tube) is slanted back at an angle of ~72-74, meaning roughly 15 from straight up-and-down.
The mounting portion of this, though, perfectly straight up and down, meaning that your blinky light (which you desperately want to say HERE I AM!!! to cars coming from behind) is point down toward the ground at a 15 angle.  So, unless the aforementioned vehicle is coming at you from the centre of the earth roughly 2-3m behind your bike, the biggest impact of the light is being wasted. 
Sure, it's still visible, but for almost $50 from a company that spouts "engineered design" as a mantra....pretty weak effort.

Look at the photo attached (and this is one of Lezyne's own marketing photos): does a great job of lighting up that rear tire because.....?

Save your money, go buy something for half the price that does point straight back.  I'd return it, but I missed the window, so I'm stuck trying to cobble together some mounting system that has the "strip" perpendicular to the ground instead of pointing at it.
review.name: Poor design

name: Strip Drive 300 Plus Tail Light

review.reviewBody:
The Dispatch helmet does not include clips for securing the ear straps in place, a feature present in the Express model. This omission means that the ear straps become misaligned every time the helmet is removed or carried, requiring frequent readjustments to maintain proper fit and effectiveness. This not only compromises the helmet's safety but also detracts from the overall user experience, as it takes time to fix the straps when they get completely messed up.

I'm disappointed by this design choice, particularly given that the Dispatch is marketed as a "NEW MODEL" and priced so much higher than the Express. It's puzzling why such a useful feature would be omitted in what is supposed to be an upgraded version of your product.
review.name: No ear strap clips: A surprising downgrade

review.reviewBody: I decided to give this helmet a try because I've been looking for one that carries both Mips + NTA 8776 certifications. I like the look of this helmet, the matte finish is nice and overall it feels well made. I like the idea of the rear light but didn't use it. The straps are soft and the fidlock buckle is great. I'm not sure if the ventilation would be adequate, as I returned the helmet before using it. I was between sizes and opted to size down. I probably should have gone with the bigger size as this one causes uncomfortable pressure as soon as I put it on. Due to the size, I'm unable to make adjustments to increase the overall comfort.
review.name: Nice helmet

review.reviewBody: Wanted to get a MIPs helmet so thought I'd try a Smith product after seeing all their great online reviews. The quality and build of the Smith Dispatch is fantastic as is their shipping time, however, it's not a very good fit for a 'round' head. Fit is true to size, but have found it uncomfortable after a short time period while riding. To get it comfortable without any 'pinch spots', the adjustment needs to be dialed to the point where the helmet is getting too loose. The chin strap also slips loose easily, and am having to re-adjust it during rides. I wanted to give this helmet a chance, but it's definitely not a 'keeper', and since I've used it and can't return it...it's one for the goodwill donation bin I suppose.
review.name: Not for 'round' heads

review.reviewBody: I bought this helmet primarily for use on my e-scooter to get from my car to my various work places in downtown Seattle. Helmet is super comfortable and looks good on top of it. Minimal mushroom head! Helmet is also reasonably lightweight. As it is mostly closed on top I most likely use when I ride my bicycle on rainy winter days. I bought the Poppy Red color, as it was on sale. The color was my only real concern when ordering as to whether Id like it or not, I like it. The clip on LED light is also a nice added feature. Overall this is solid helmet, just what I was looking for. Definitely recommended
review.name: Great Commuter helmet

review.reviewBody:
The weight and interior padding make this helmet very comfortable. The color, orange, I purchased make the helmet very visible. Unfortunately Smith charges extra for a neon green helmet. 
I would like to be informed when Smith will be producing a folding helmet (using mips & other technologies. It has to fold as compactly as my previous not certified helmet.
review.name: Wonderful helmet.

review.reviewBody: And super stylish! The buckle took a second to get used to though.
review.name: Fits well on my big head

review.reviewBody: The right helmet for me. The fiddy lock works great, the fit is right & adjustable, And the removable, rechargeable light on the back assures added safety.
review.name: Right for me with these features

review.reviewBody: Great fit, very comfortable, and really light weight!
review.name: Great fit, very comfortable, and

review.reviewBody: I've spent a fair amount of days in this helmet riding my eBike around town. I feel super safe in this helmet knowing it passes the eBike certification! It's incredibly light weight with 2 big lightweight Koroyd panels at the side/back. Since its so light weight you truly forget you're wearing it! I really like the magnetic Fidlock buckle and how easy it is to put on and feel secure when it snaps together - truly a one handed operation. The overall aesthetic of the helmet is perfect, I really like the clean lines and matte finish, a lot of eBike helmets seem blown up or big but this helmet keeps a nice low profile. Plus, the integrated light is so sleek - it's so nice to always have a bright light that moves with you when you're riding from a to b in the darker hours. Overall, this is an amazing helmet for eBike commuting/riding and honestly its a great helmet for any type of urban cycling!
review.name: Super safe, super comfy!

name: Dispatch Mips Helmet

hasVariant.description: Buy the Smith Attack MAG MTB ChromaPop Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: My pair broke where the lenses and the arms attached. It was not covered by the so-called "lifetime warranty." I have other Smith products, and I can't believe the poor quality of these frames in comparison. Avoid, avoid, avoid.
review.name: Poor Quality

review.reviewBody: The lens of my pair wore down over time where the arms attach to the frame and eventually broke. Despite advertising a lifetime warranty on the glasses, Smith says this is not covered. I would not recommend these sunglassesthere are higher quality options at lower or similar prices (i.e., POC or Oakley).
review.name: Low Quality Materials

review.reviewBody: I have quite a few Smith glasses I use for cycling. I typically recommend them to other. This model is quite different. I was resting mid ride and pulled these glasses off and the part of the lens that connects to the arm broke. Nothing rough or aggressive and they just snapped. Unfortunately not covered under warranty. I'd stick to the models that have full frame connections.
review.name: Susceptible To Breaking

review.reviewBody: Two pairs broke in the exact same way. The glue where the lens meets the frame failed. these are otherwise undamaged and smith refused to warranty the 2nd pair. Such a bummer, because the optics on these are quite nice. The only other issue is that the way they sit on my face, I end up with a lot of sweat on the inside of the lens. Anyway, avoid these as the mag connection is nice, but not at the expense of durability. Smith's warranty terms have also been updated to include "The warranty program does not include a product that is lost, stolen, dropped, sat on, stepped on, run over, shattered, chewed by your pet, or any other damage that is caused by misuse, abuse, or negligence; the warranty does not cover damage caused by accident, improper care, negligence, normal wear and tear, or the natural breakdown of colors and material through time, exposure or extensive use." Those terms are so vague that they can include anything in "normal wear and tear, natural breakdown, or extensive use. In short their once awesome warranty is now largely useless.
review.name: Smith quality isn't what it used to be

review.reviewBody: I purchased my lenses a year ago. The plastic hinge disattached to the lense, so I cannot attach the arm to the hinge and glass. Where can I get them fixed?
review.name: Defective product

review.reviewBody: These Smith glasses stay on very well. Hardly any need to push back onto you nose. I wear a size medium helmet (just to give you an estimate on my head size) and the sides don't squeeze my head at all. I can ride with these glasses all day. But the best quality is the field of vision; I can see everything without have the frames in my peripheral.
review.name: Best Pair of Glasses So Far

review.reviewBody:
8th pair of SMITH's First pair of photo chromatic lenses, pretty cool!
Wish the glasses part came in white, but all in all super happy with them, keeps wind and dirt out of your eyes, the Wild Cats are a little too far from my face to really protest ALL the dust and crud, but these do the trick!
 Typical SMITH- awesome product/ awesome brand
Thanks
review.name: photo chromatic lenses are pretty cool!

review.reviewBody: These were my regular riding sunglasses for mt biking. They worked well until the lens broke apart where its joins with the frame, rendering them unusable. The first time it happened, Smith warrantied them, so I was a satisfied customer. But the same exact issue happened a second time after only two seasons of riding. I was then was denied a warranty replacement for the same issue that was accepted prior. I was told it was "normal wear" for the lens to break in that manner, and offered a 30% discount code instead. So much for a lifetime warranty, this is clearly a design defect. Stay away from these sunglasses.
review.name: Frame broke twice from regular use, design defect

review.reviewBody:
Ive been wearing SMITH optics for 8 years since I picked up a set in Utah on a trip. I have always used multiple lenses and found the vision to be clear and the coverage to be great with my contact lenses. The 2 lenses in this set are superior to anything Ive used before. The photochromic lens changes darkness based on the ambient light and it it fast and smooth. The Chromapop technology really does improve trail contract and visibility for me. These lenses provide good coverage for my face and fit perfectly with my ForeFront2, Mainline, and Session helmets. The fit seems to keep just the right amount of airflow to prevent fogging.The SMITH MAG arm system is faster and easier than the PIVLOCK system for quick changes. The nose piece is adjustable to customize how high they sit on your face which is really nice. The glasses stay put on your face with sticky rubber and the arms stay open so its easy to remove and put them on one-handed. The case is the standard SMITH case which last well if you take care not to get the zipper dirty or wet. The cleaning case and rag is essential for cleaning.I rated these 4 out of 5 because I did have a problem with the MAG magnets rusting due to sweat. I do ride more than the average rider as an instructor and I have very acidic body chemistry so this is not a common problem, but something to be aware of. I suggest removing and drying the MAG clips after riding to reduce sitting moisture on the magnets. (If youre concerned, go with the Ruckus using PIVLOCK instead). Also, the lenses are durable, but not super hard so they can be scratched when cleaning so be sure to rise the lens first with water if there is any mud when cleaning.
I still have my Utah pair of PIVLOCKs after 10 years. These are excellent glasses especially when worn with SMITH helmets.
review.name: Great fit and protection with superior photochromic lenses

review.reviewBody:
I like these, easy to keep the lens with you if light conditions change while youre out, and very easy to swap. Clarity like youd expect of ChromaPop, youre in for a treat if you havent used Smiths lenses. Comfortable enough, the black curtains in your peripheral vision takes a little getting used to but you can rationally explain to yourself why those are there and get on with your life! 
Only thing to note is theyre hot! If you live and ride in desert summer temps, expect to feel the difference if youve been wearing eyewear that doesnt cover as much of your face. That said, the way my eyes water when the air is even a little bit cool, these glasses are going to be perfect now that temps are tailing off.
Im glad not to be riding in my Guides Choice anymore, these are perfectly suited for activity and worth the investment as long as I look after them!
review.name: Quality versatile piece of  kit

name: Attack MAG MTB ChromaPop Sunglasses

description: Buy the Maxxis All Terrane EXO/TR Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: All Terrane EXO/TR Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Maxxis All Terrane EXO/TR Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Donnelly PDX's were out of stock and love Maxxis mtb tires which are mounted on 3 of my bikes so took a chance with this Maxxis "All Terrane" which looked/sounded good on paper.

Upon receipt I noticed the knobs are even taller than the photos, which wouldn't be such a bad thing, but even with low pressure (24 psi) or high they only measure 31mm in width (see photo). I mounted to wider carbon rims and DT Swiss aluminum with same results. Not even close to the 33mm advertised (or 34mm actual of the PDX on same rims) but at least you won't have to worry about the UCI calipers at the start.

Did a few dry races then raced a super punchy, technical cx race course that included a sand pit. They hooked up nicely in the damp grass including climbs and blasted through the sand pit but I lacked confidence in the slick off cambers and single track that I normally excel in due to their narrowness.

Even though they're 120tpi, they feel super stiff and not supple at all. Thus the 2 star review as although they may be durable and ok for some gravel or single track fun, they are not a great cx race tire which explains why you don't see even their sponsored pro's racing them or find many reviews.

Into the scrap bin and await Donnelly's to arrive back in stock...
review.name: Not a fan for cx racing

name: All Terrane EXO/TR Tire

review.reviewBody: I bought the glasses about a month ago and super glad I did. I was going to get a Tifosi pair but ended up buying these due to the reviews about the comfort.  I hardly notice these are on my head! They are super lightweight. Provide great protection with the oversized lenses and they breathe super well. I have not used the adjustable nose piece as the fit seems great as is. I was a little concerned the first time I changed the lenses that I might break something, but now that I've done it a few times, they pop in and out very easily. The carrying case is fantastic and overall I couldn't be happier!  If I had one thing I would add is I wish Smith made available for purchase a photo chromatic lense for these frames
review.name: Great glasses!

review.reviewBody: I was looking for lightweight performance sunglasses for trail running and other outdoor activities this spring. Ive had my pair since May and have used them almost daily since then while training for a half marathon. I chose these glasses over the bobcat because of the adjustable nose feature. I rarely have issues of them sliding off my face that only happens when I wear sunscreen on my nose on a hot day. I have a smaller face but the smallest nose setting works great for me! Im impressed by how easy it is the remove the lense and the durability of these! They are beautiful and a statement piece, I always get compliments when I wear them. Im considering buying a replacement lense because Im hopeful to have these for a long time! I would absolutely buy these again in a heartbeat. 10/10 would recommend!
review.name: Stellar Performance Glasses

review.reviewBody: These are exactly what I was looking for. I wish the lenses could be switched out quicker and hopefully that will be an option in the future. They look great and provide excellent coverage.
review.name: These are exactly what I

review.reviewBody: These frames started awesome (I have the pink/blue ones), so much that I also purchased the photocromic lenses. Use for MTB and backcountry skiing. Noticed that the frame color started to fade and got "sticky" so the material was deteriorating. Smith said wasn't covered under warranty. Lame. Beware of longevity.
review.name: Great frames for a bit and then disintegrated

review.reviewBody: Loved these glasses but the hinge gave out on me. I completely expected that the issue would be covered by the Smith lifetime warranty but they denied my claim saying the issue was not covered under their warranty. I feel their warranty policy is grossly misleading and I'm sad they do not stand by their products like other outdoor brands.
review.name: Smith will not honor warranty claims

review.reviewBody: Used them for riding for 2 years and the hinge broke when my wife was taking them off. No impact or damage, just a clean break. They denied the warranty. The warranty and reputation is why we spent twice as much as other glasses like this. Definitely wouldnt recommend
review.name: Really disappointed

review.reviewBody: The lens cracked within a year.  Smith will deny the warranty claim, saying you must have misused it.  All I did was wear them while cycling, gently clean them, and then store them in the case until I would need them again.  At no point were they misused or damaged due to an accident.  The crack happened from normal wear and tear.
review.name: Lens Cracked Within a Year

review.reviewBody: Poor fit and mediocre lens compared to similarly priced brands. I tried to get used to these for about two months before ditching them for Oakley Sutros. The Wildcat frames are definitely in my peripheral view for biking and the upper lens will touch my eyebrows leaving a nice smudge every time I wear them. The frames also did not fit under my Smith brand helmet. They helped block the wind a little bit but did not prevent my eyes from watering. My first ride with the Sutros I forgot I had them on they were so comfortable, my eyes did not water, and their Prizm lens tech is far superior, no comparison.
review.name: Far better options for the price

review.reviewBody: Ive been training in these both bike and running. And wore them through my bike and run in my last Triathlon. Didnt move an inch, light weight, comfortable and have a wide visibility range. Highly recommend.
review.name: Perfect for Triathlons

review.reviewBody: I have a big head and these are comfortable. On the bike they do exactly what they're supposed to. Chromapop is the bomb. Terrain contours are easily delineated. Changing lenses is easy. The wildchilds look red on three screen but are actually pink and purple. They live up too their name. So comfortable i wear them as my daily glasses. Just ordered some soundtracks so that might change though.
review.name: Super Rad!

name: Wildcat ChromaPop Sunglasses

review.reviewBody:
I bought the medium last winter and had it on my gravel bike all spring, summer and fall.
It's great in those shoulder seasons when you're not sure on the weather and want to bring some options, plus tools, phone and  energy bar. I'm not bike packing with it. I like it and never notice it on the bike, it's week connected. It performs well when you have fluffy stuff like jackets in there. It's a pain when you take out that jacket and have say tools and phone in there, railing around. The phone was difficult , because it's too big to put deep in the bag, the plastic casing of the BOA is a little tight on those things. So I end up getting it tight with the rollup and straps. it still bounces around and I twice emergency dialed 911 on my phone because of it, in different places but both times bouncing on heavy gravel roads/trails. I should probably have phone in a pocket but I don't always wear bike shirts. i know more seasoned riders i ride with in summer think it's overkill and maybe they're right in summer.  Still it's a well made bag that connects well and stays in place that I'd recommend even though its expensive. It's still on my bike.
review.name: Good storage for spring and fall rides

review.reviewBody: My seatbagarrived fast, and their customer service is awesome. I love to be able to a US based live person, which is suoer friendly and efficient. That in itself sets Backcountry apart. The bag itself is small enough and can be squeezed using its strap. The strap itself could be easier to pass through the saddle rails, but thats not a deal braker. Overall, very good.
review.name: Great experience and product

review.reviewBody: I have this bag on all three of my bikes. It's big enough to hold the bare essentials and it looks good as well.
review.name: Great minimalist bag

review.reviewBody:
I reevaluated some life choices in 2023 -- do I really want to continue to haul around crap I never use (even on solo, massive rides to the middle of nowhere) in a huge, unsightly saddle sack? "No," I said, "this nonsense ends this year." This is a good-looking, minimalist bag. It fits a tube, small mini-tool with only essential hex wrenches, tire lever, and a patch kit. The CO2 inflator and cartridge can now live in the jersey pocket baggie along with their friends: couple of twenties, tube of lip balm, tire boot, transit rail card. My sack no longer flails around, banging my saddle and post like a fish in the bottom of the boat or sounding like a sock full of nickels, and I no longer suffer the opprobrium of fellow cyclists at the cafe. I now glide over the roads like an aero Adonis. My new-found confidence and reduced weight has shaved seconds off my PR on the local climbs. I've Marie Kondo-ed my ride. Not missing the extra crap. 

We'll see how it holds up in the rainy season, but preliminary indications are good.
review.name: Minimalist bag, may change your life

review.reviewBody:
Nice little pack! Looks good on my bike and fits my saddles rails perfectly, with the Velcro overlapping exactly. I ride a 145 Selle Italia Tenno Flite) 

Fits 1 tube, a pack of patches, co2, & tire lever. Wouldnt recommend cramming too much more than that bc the pack would probably not work properly.
review.name: Perfect for the minimalist cyclist

name: Uno Seatbag

review.reviewBody:
Went with a 0.5 size up from my TTS to account for the fact Ill most likely be wearing these with thick socks most of the time, but didnt need to go a full size up like I would with normal hiking boots.

Ive been walking around in 30 weather, chasing kids around all week with toasty warm feet. Just did the final test: short socks. The mid rise top didnt rub on my achilles, and honestly the ankle pad was so soft I might do a short sock and 7/8 jean look this weekend.

I didnt lace to the top, which is pretty standard for me.

Overall, really comfortable for bumming around and Ill probably get a pair of the slip on ones in the future.
review.name: Nanny tested, nanny approved

review.reviewBody: I had these exact boots and used them extensively for backpacking in the Sierra Nevada in the 80s -not that I want to date myself. They are light, no break-in, stable and most of all because they fit me perfectly. I have a narrow, ie low volume foot, and these fit without any slippage. If this describes your feet, I cant recommend to highly.
review.name: Glad I found these boots!

review.reviewBody: They are nice light weight hiking boots.i wish I had purchased half size bigger.
review.name: Nice light weight moderate hiking boots

review.reviewBody: These boots looked and performed absolutely flawlessly. I couldnt be more pleased with them. We crushed Iceland together. No break in at all. Totally comfortable and waterproof.
review.name: Simply the best.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable with no break in really required
review.name: Great lightweight hiker

review.reviewBody: Great looking boot, seems sturdy and well constructed but runs big and the shoe dug into the top of my foot when walking. I've read other reviews about this flaw and it's true. Returned.
review.name: Disappointing

review.reviewBody: I was super excited to have my first pair of Danner boots and couldn't wait to break them in. I used them for an easy hike along a creek and quickly discovered they have no traction on slick terrain. I wouldn't trust to wear them again on a hike where it was wet or raining. However, they would be great for wearing around town and on dry terrain! They are super comfortable, and I had no issues breaking them in.
review.name: I wanted to love them

review.reviewBody:
I remember these Danners from the 80's and I always yearned to have them but never had the $.  I was elated when they re-released this style.
I've worn them hiking in the N. Ga mountains and they're pretty awesome.
I will say- the lacing is everything with these.  When I first got them, and had the skinny laces in, I thought I might need insoles that were better.  I changed out the laces for the retro ones that came with the shoes and I can lace them tighter and they fit much, much better.  I don't know why there's a difference but lacing them correctly makes them hit my feet in a different spot or something.  I ordered a 1/2 size down per sizing chart and other reviews, and that seems the correct way to buy these.
They look super cool, and feel great and seem as though they will hold up well!  I'm stoked.
review.name: kickin it old school

hasVariant.name: Rampart Tubeless Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Teravail Rampart Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
After a significant review/selection process, I chose the Teravail Rampart tubeless tire (700c x 38 wide) to ride East Bay Area regional park gravel and hard pavement roads. My rides typically include road and gravel, nominally 30-50 miles long and in the range of 2000"-5000" elevation gain. A long duration product search know-doubt creates buyer bias. Nonetheless, I am stunned by how well this tire grips hardpack, dirt, and even with a bit of gravel trails. The Rampart holds remarkably high road/trail traction.

I recently road sporadically wet fire trails a few weeks ago (Santa Cruz) and I had to really pedal hard to cause rear wheel/tire slip. If you are not a road/trail racer (gram minder) and appreciate tires that measurably enhance ride confidence (I'm middle aged) - give these Teravail Ramparts a go - And GO!
review.name: Remarkable Sticking Power

name: Rampart Tubeless Tire

review.reviewBody: This is a great piece to add to any waredrobe if you live in an area with a cooler climate or you happen to be traveling to an area that has a cooler climate.  I live in the Bay Area and it works quite well on its own for quick errands around the neighborhood or underneath a down jacket on windy days.  It is super soft and keeps me warm.  I love the length and it seemed to get softer after I washed it.  The zipper can be a tiny bit finicky, but after an initial struggle I haven't had any trouble with it since.  I think that the sizing is true to size for the most part if you want to wear a sweater with it, but if you like your jackets on the fitted / tighter side then I would say to size down.
review.name: Great fleece!

review.reviewBody: The fleece material is quite thin.  The one I ordered was too large - I ordered M which usually works for me. Had to return this one.
review.name: Thin material

review.reviewBody: I really love the quality of this Kuhl jacket/coat but will have to return it because the fit on me is too big.  I am 5' 3" and 140 lbs and my arms are short because I'm short.  I thought Kuhl ran small so I ordered this in a size large and it is definitely too big in both the body and too long in the arms.  I didn't return it right away as I was hoping if I saw my sister at Christmas, it might fit her but she was unable to visit.  Sadly I have to return it.
review.name: Beautiful coat/jacket!!!!

name: Ascendyr Long Fleece Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I use this primarily as a base layer for cold weather activities. Also under waders or a drysuit. The current version is much better than the older version which fit far too tight.  The repositioned pocket is great.  The one thing that should be incorporated is a fly which makes it much easier when using this as a base layer.
review.name: Great Base Layer

review.reviewBody: This fleece layer is good as an underlayer or outer layer with sufficient stretch to ensure movements remain uninhibited. Great for running, skiing, etc. It's also hard to beat on a cold day by the fire. After receiving one, I ordered two more pairs with variations in sizing for a slightly different fit. Normal sizing is a skin fit for athletic builds.
review.name: Holy Comfy

review.reviewBody: These are my favorite slightly relaxed leggings for running under about 45 degrees. They're just snug enough to feel streamlined when running fast, stay warm in Seattle's cold winter rain, and deal well with sweat and body heat under high exertion like during track workouts and hill repeats. I thought the previous version was a 4/5 due to a too-tight waistband and an inconvenient pocket placement down by the knee. This new version fixes those issues with a waistband that has great stretch and a pocket that is moved up to the waist to minimize bounce of a phone, cards, or energy gels.
review.name: Perfect winter running leggings

review.reviewBody: I purchased these to wear in extreme cold weather, over two layers of merino wool 250 g/m underlayers and beneath OR hardshell bibs. I thought I understood what "trim fit" meant. I didn't think it was a trim fit for a starving famine refugee. Even worse, they are about four inches (10 cm) too long. I rated them three stars because I can still use them when worn as a base layer over nothing and assuming I can roll up the leg bottoms into makeshift cuffs. I do not recommend this product.
review.name: Way too long...way too tight.

name: Vigor Bottom - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my son and he likes them I think they look dumb.
review.name: Not a fan

review.reviewBody: Ive worn these shorts every day since I got them. Im 511 with a 34 inch waist and I got a medium, they fit really well. Not too short and not too loose. I cut the liner out because I wear these casually and not just as swim trunks. The price is pretty steep for a pair of shorts, but Im happy with them. Will probably buy another pair at some point.
review.name: Love these shorts

review.reviewBody: The shorts themselves are very fashionable however, though specified in the information tab, while the inseam itself is 5" the length of the short above that is much longer than one might expect. In the pictures it seems as though the shorts would have fit relatively comfortably around the mid thigh, in reality they sit much closer to the knee than I would have expected from a 5" inseam short. Not really a design flaw though something to look out for before buying.
review.name: Great Shorts Weird Length

review.reviewBody: These are true to size and incredibly lightweight yet durable.  Definitely need a pair of this in your closet!
review.name: Great Staple Shorts

review.reviewBody: I bought these primarily for a 7-day Kayaking trip in Baja. I essentially wore them for 7 straight days for 8+ hours a day. They held up against the salt and sand very well. The color I bought looked great (tigerlily orange) and while it has some built in grime now still looks pretty solid and didnt fade out. I would recommend these for people looking for a pair of swim shorts.
review.name: Great Shorts for Kayaking

review.reviewBody:
Great fit. Dont ride up when you walk like some swim shorts. 
Would buy again.
review.name: GREAT SWIM SHORTS

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love these shorts. I cut the mesh lining out before trying them on which was a mistake because I would have returned them if not. They are very restrictive on movement and maybe the shorter inseam would be better. They look very nice but my $10 old navy swim shorts are more comfortable.  I love Patagonia but not so much these shorts.
review.name: Meh, not stretchy and the fit is weird

review.reviewBody: I love Patagonia's stuff but had reservations about these baggies. After trying them out, I'm hooked! I've always used board shorts and still will. but these have quickly become my go-to when going swimming or paddleboarding. Fit is great and true to size. They seem very well made and like they'll last for years to come! Quickly dries which makes them even better. usually pretty good to go after packing up the ISUP and getting the 4runner loaded to head back home or camp.
review.name: Had some reservations

review.reviewBody: The baggies are a go to for me when it comes to shorts. Super casual and comfortable for everyday use. The liner it comes in can easily be cut off based on preference. Such a classic  pair of shorts that I will continue to wear.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody:
I've been wearing Baggies since the late 80's. I've used them for Mt Biking, Climbing, Tennis, Backpacking, Swimming, Surfing, Hiking and Lounging. I went through my last pair in the late 90's, and didn't get another pair until recently. 

They were great back then, but they're now dated. There are better shorts out there for most uses, as they have a number of design flaws:

- They don't have a zipper on any of the pockets. Making them nearly impossible to securely hold anything (e.g., a credit card) during an outing. 

- The interior liner isn't particularly comfortable. The pockets are structured so if there's anything in them they hang down, and the liner bunches up. 

- The interior corded key-ring is a nice addition, but its dark color stained the lighter my lighter colored shorts. 

For hiking, I'd rather wear my Patagonia 9 Trails shorts, which are great. For surfing/swimming, I'd rather wear a pair of board shorts. For tennis and other forms of exercise, I'd rather wear something with a compression liner to keep my bits for bouncing about. About the only thing these shorts are great for is hanging out at home NOT doing anything, which seems distinctly off brand for Patagonia and a short that has been labeled the "original fun-hogs." They're just OK for everything else.
review.name: A Classic Whose Time Has Come

review.reviewBody: Much more difficult to put boots on & to take off. I'm used to easily stepping into boots, these were similar putting on a ski boot. However once on they feel great.
review.name: Great fit & Arch support

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and great looking, true to size and I would absolutely recommend these boots!!
review.name: Great boots

review.reviewBody: These boots are not up to everyday use. Wore though and started leaking from the heel. Bad quality and they do not stand by their product. Don't buy!
review.name: Wore through just past 1 yr mark

review.reviewBody: Bought these as a gift for my son and he loves them.
review.name: Great boot

review.reviewBody: I love how they fit and look but they are not warm on the snow. After a few minutes inside my feet get very sweaty.
review.name: Nice look, not warm

review.reviewBody: They are way too stiff at the opening ( lower leg) not breaking in and giving me deep rubs - even with long Johns . Not happy with this design -
review.name: Stiff

review.reviewBody: Very nice quality and my husband is thrilled with how easy they are to get on and how warm they are
review.name: Comfortable, stylish and versatile

review.reviewBody: I own 4 pair of Bogs shoes/boots, all size 9, and all fit slightly differently, though all are comfortable. These boots have the best fit of all my Bogs. They are snug, but not too tight. They are also as warm as you might expect. My only issue with them is that the top of the boot initially rubbed against my shin causing some irritation. The boots have broken in somewhat, however, and this has became less of an issue.
review.name: Good fitting, warm boots.

review.reviewBody: In comparison to other brand footwear, mine were, maybe, 1/2 size large. But, my feet are small and narrow. Compensating with thicker socks. Would not trade them.....
review.name: Great Boots

review.reviewBody: The Arcata Chelsea boots are comfortable, warm, and good traction. I also have the Bozeman for the most extreme conditions. I bought the Chelsea for more "everyday" winter wear once the snow hit.
review.name: Comfortable, warm, good traction.

name: Arcata Urban Chelsea Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I had my son pick out new gloves for Christmas and he thought these would look cool since theyre white, and he liked that theyre wool inside instead of synthetic (he had worn out his previous pair of Hestra gloves in size 11). We got these in the same size 11 but unfortunately they were comically huge. They looked like paddles on they were so wide, and the tight spot on the wrist kept sliding down as he snowboarded, so they were hanging off his fingers too. He still wanted them for the wool lining, so we exchanged for size 10 and theyre the perfect size! To keep from washing the wool often, he wants to get liners to wear with these. How cool that manufacturers are slowly going back to what nature gave us so we can avoid microplastics in our bodies. Thanks, Backcountry, for handling our return and giving store credit for an unfortunate situation.
review.name: Great but run big

name: Mono Wool Mitt

review.reviewBody: I used this for a boost for a 5k I was doing. It really did give me that extra boost to continue it.

review.reviewBody: Great breakfast choice for me. delicious and very easy to eat on the go.

review.reviewBody: these have true Chocolate Chip Cookie Taste.... had to order these factory direct because nobody can keep 'em in stock!! Being 9 miles from closest ride area & having no CDL I only go on Saturdays for a whole day & have to stop myself from dipping into my Clif Chocolate Chip Bar during the week!!

review.reviewBody: Great for Mtb'n... for a full day of play i bring 2 bananas, 2 Clif bars (different flavors), 24 oz electrolyte, 12 oz electrolyte re-fill, 2 litres clean water

review.reviewBody: I use the chocolate chip bar for in between meals or on the go when I need a boost. It also helps if you need to control your weight and it is very good for the digestive system if you have a problem with being unable to go to the bathroom. It has great fiber for these moments!
review.name: Great protein bar with great taste!

review.reviewBody: Perfect blend of chocolate and peanut. Best after a yoga class or before a 40 mile bike ride.
review.name: My favorite Clif Bar.!

review.reviewBody: I keep these in our break room in case someone missed breakfast or has low blood sugar. Great to have around!
review.name: An office staple

review.reviewBody: Feel the energy but not the feel of being full. Enjoy the workout to the utmost.

review.reviewBody: I purchased a lifestraw go 1lt water bottle after reading all the glowing reviews. Ive previously used lifestraw while hiking, with no issues and the bottle seemed like a no brainer. What an expensive mistake. The water tastes disgusting. Foul. Plasticky. The water tastes like latex smells. Im not joking. The first taste made me vomit. And that was after cleaning the bottle, lid, mouthpiece, and prepping the filter as per the instructions. So I cleaned, rinsed, and tried again. Still foul. Still gag worthy. At least I didnt vomit! Several cleans, rinses, and different water later, and it still tastes foul. Sorry guys, this is a no from me. And these things are EXPENSIVE as here in Australia. A big let down.
review.name: Disgusting taste, like powdery plastic

review.reviewBody: A treat on a recent 3 week visit in Philippines. Tap water, restaurant ice water, all perfectly safe.
review.name: I won't travel without it

review.reviewBody: Overpriced for sure, it's hard to draw tge water through.
review.name: Overpriced for sure, it's hard

review.reviewBody: I was really excited to get my bottle and I am still glad to have it for traveling. However, the resistance is fairly high when sucking directly through the straw that by the end of a day of using it I tend to have a headache. As a result, I am not using it as my daily bottle, only for traveling. The quality is high, it's just impractical for me as a heavy water drinker
review.name: Good quality, hard to drink

review.reviewBody: I bought two of the smaller Lifestraw bottles to take on a two week trip where we were playing 'planes, trains and automobiles' so to speak, plus ferries. The bottles were easier to carry than the larger ones we had and we had plenty of opportunities to fill them. Trips back a couple years we got plastic water bottles as we traveled, tried to recycle but that option isn't always available. This kept us away from that and (I think) more microplastics in the water. We always had a drink of water for a hike or ? handy.
review.name: Smaller bottle better for travel.

review.reviewBody: should have read description before I purchased. wanted to filter ice from machine with drinks of my choice... can't use anything but water in it or it contaminates the filter..money wasted..might not be so bad if it wasn't so hard to draw from straw!
review.name: My Bad

review.reviewBody: Love my Lifestraw! Brought one for everyone in my family who took it to Africa! Great for travel when one often has to rely on bottled water from plastic bottles.
review.name: My family doesnt travel without our Lifestraw bottles.

review.reviewBody: I love my water bootle but it has been leaking a lot. I can't lay it on its side or it will leak despite the top being on the lid being tight. It will also leak from the cap when just standing. Works as a filter, I used it all over Ecuador but not really useful for daily because of the leaks
review.name: I would love it, if it didn't leak

review.reviewBody: We took this to Colombia and only drank water from this. We even filled it up at a waterfall on a hike. We have used river water in it. Never gotten sick. Amazing.
review.name: Excellent for hiking and places where water is sketchy

review.reviewBody:
The instructions mention to burp the bottle before flying as it may overflow in flight. However this became a everyday thing for me. Leaving the bottle in a hot car, or entering a AC building it would overflow. Even in you "burp" or blow back into the straw water can over flow when there is large pressure change. My car's bottle holders often had water in the bottom, then it dipped on my while driving. If the bottle was in my back pack and I did not "burp" it I would find a wet pack later in the day. I do need a filter for micro plastics which is the reason I chose this bottle. Sorry LifeStraw, I love your products but this bottle was just not functional for me.
side note: I have worked with your team on a solution a few weeks ago. I had the same problems with the replacement bottle they sent. me.
review.name: High Maintenance

name: Go Series Water Filter 22oz Bottle
