description: Buy the Shimano PD-ES600 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PD-ES600 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano PD-ES600 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Like most of us roadies, me and my friends are doing much more gravel stuff, but we still do lots of road sections. These pedals are a great in-between. I love SPD cleats for walking and for hike-a-bike sections (spoken by a life-long Speed Play guywhich do NOT lend themselves well to walking at all, much less over dirt, rocks, and the occasional climbing over fences). With all that said, Im surprised these are the only pedal I could find that work well in both road and dirt environments (if there are others, I couldnt find them). They are also great quality at a very reasonable price!
review.name: The only gig in town

review.reviewBody: Overall I'm happy with the PD-ES600 pedals.  They have great power transfer and good foot support while allowing you to wear recessed cleat shoes.  My only complaint is they tend to flip over making it difficult to clip in sometimes.  The paint has begun to chip off from trying to get clipped in when this happens.  I have about 175 miles on them at this point I was hoping they would break in and stop flipping, they have not yet but I am learning to flip it over quickly but it's not always possible.
review.name: Good SPD road pedals

review.reviewBody: Just installed and the right pedal is almost impossible to clip in/out, even with maximum float.  It?s a nice, light pedal that looks good with my road bike.  Going to exchange.
review.name: Beware: May come defective

review.reviewBody:
As long as one is not pushing the limits of technical riding, these are fantastic pedals for gravel.  The only drawback could be if one is riding terrain which requires lots of unclipping and putting the foot down, as being one sided, clipping back in is not always as fast as it would be with a two sided MTB pedal.
Pluses: SPD clip in and release action is the gold standard, and easily adjustable for desired retention.  One gets to use a recessed cleat shoe if the need to walk a section comes along.  Mud performance much better than road pedals.  The platform on these is large, and one can feel the additional support and power transfer (vs MTB  XC pedals).  Very low stack height, and higher ground clearance than double sided MTB pedals-great for modern low BB gravel bikes.  Lightweight vs any MTB pedals.  And, very affordable.  Super smooth bearings, as is normally the case with all Shimano pedals.  BTW, for those marginal gains types, Boca Bearings makes a relatively affordable ceramic ball upgrade which will work with these pedals.
I actually use road shoes, with an adapter for SPD cleats with these, for a really lightweight and stiff setup (Giro Empire SLX)-with the adapter the road shoes walk well enough to get through the occasional unrideable section.
Only a complete road pedal set up would be more efficient and lighter, for gravel rides which are known to be dry, and completely non-technical (no walking), a Dura Ace pedal and road shoe would be my choice-but for most gravel rides, these are perfect.
review.name: Great Pedals for gravel!

name: PD-ES600 Pedals

description: Buy the Burley Dash FM Carrier online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Dash FM Carrier
hasVariant.description: Buy the Burley Dash FM Carrier online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It arrived quickly and it only took about 45 minutes to unpack and fully install on my bike. I've been using it for three weeks and two observations caught my attention. The straps are difficult to adjust when you need to tighten them down, one of them has a tendency to fall off my child's shoulder. The other is the seatback is made of a very soft and cheap material that tears easily where the harness goes through it and into the seat back. Other than that I like the product. It seems well constructed and is easy to remove and reinstall. I don't regret buying it and I think it's a decent value. Some more wear resistant materials and better harness adjustment design would make it a good value.
review.name: Good purchase but some room for improvement.

review.reviewBody: I struggled to find a child seat option that would work for me. I tested a trailer once and was not a fan, and it wasnt practical for getting around town. One reason I struggled to find a seat that would work is I have a gravel bike, which the geometry made it tricky to find any option that would work. Second reason is I am only 56 and have a 52cm frame, so there is limited mounting space on my bike. I spent quite a long time researching and comparing products and most options werent possible at alluntil I found this seat. The 4 min mounting space just fits onto my seat tube and has been a dream to have. I take a lot of 1-2 mile trips around my town and my child and I both HATE getting in the car, this seat has brought life changing freedom to my life.
review.name: Love this purchase

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This spring my grandson was to heavy to strap on my back. He had grown and needed a safe seat of his own for my bike. 

I researched the quality and safety of a child's bike seat as that was tremendously important to me. Our grandson is our world. The straps will grow with him as well making this seat a great purchase. I looked at other child seats, but they were not nearly as effective and safe.

I had to expect it would be easy to install the Dash FM (Frame Mount) - Extended Rails to my trike bike with out modification. Burley reasurred me the seat of my choice would fit our bike. It was a breeze to install and easy to take off when he is not with us.

I had to know when I strapped our Stormy Boy into the bike seat and took off peddling down the rode, that he would be as safe and comfortable as possible. 

He loves our precious time together. He is 2 years old and full of an adventurous spirit. The seat makes it easy for him to talk with us throughout our ride. His Nana and Papaw help him to explore his world and ours. 

Thanks Burley for enriching our life. I trust your product with my treasure! Doesn't Nana and Stormy Boy look wonderful? Gotta go as it is time to explore again.
review.name: Nana and Stormy Boy are ready again for an adventure!

review.reviewBody: Easy to install. It does feel a little wobbly, which is not ideal. But toddler loves it so far.
review.name: Easy to install. It does

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pros: (1) Burley seats are some of the few with a secure 5-point harness, not a 3-point one like Thule. (2) I bought a second mounting block, installed one block on my wife's bike and one on mine, and it's super easy to swap the seat back and forth: under 30 seconds to switch bikes. (3) My small 12-month-old (about 28" tall, 20 lbs) fits well in the seat, and it could have fit a smaller baby.

Cons: (1) The seatback angle is totally wrong. Both our bikes have seatposts 15 degrees off vertical (pretty common), which makes the Dash seat back tilt 5 degrees forward. When we hit bumps or my daughter falls asleep, she slumps forward. The Dash X (which can recline) can't have extended rails and didn't fit my wife's smaller bike, so we're stuck with this one. I don't need the recline feature; I just wish the Dash FM were permanently fixed at an angle further back. (2) The mounting block should have anti-theft screws, and you should need a key to remove the seat from the mounting block. Because it's so easy to remove, I now need to carry an extra cable for my U lock to secure the seat.
review.name: Best seat on the market for a small 1-yr-old, but the angle is pretty bad

review.reviewBody: Easy install, works well and very stable when in motion.
review.name: Easy install, works well and

review.reviewBody: Amazing for my 2.5 yo daughter! She absolutely loves going on rides with me and this feels so secure and safe! Storage dept is for little things not much! Love this!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my grandson and he loves biking with his parents. Very safe.
review.name: Great bike seat

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed with the quality, plastic flimsy,straps cheap and not wide enough, there is no safety feature to hold child in if straps are unbuttoned. My grandson played immediately with the big yellow button. I wish I had bought the one that sits on a rack, the frame one fits only one of our bike frames. He loves to ride however do I am nervously using it. Burley did not live up to its name on this one.
review.name: Very disappointed with the quality,

review.reviewBody: Awesome purchase, I couldnt be happier with the quality and ease of getting it set up on my bike. My kid also loves the seat, and I like how simple it is to get them in and out of it. Would definitely recommend.
review.name: Great Purchase!

name: Dash FM Carrier

review.name: Awesome trekking pant

review.reviewBody: Preferred the darker colour of both. Comfortable and flexible. Bought for warm weather and now wear all the time. Could have gone with shorter inseam.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: Got for warm days but wear all the time now. Very packable.
review.name: Comfortable and light

review.reviewBody: True to size! Excellent pants, breath great, dry fast, resist stains! 100% recommend! Great stretch and super comfortable
review.name: Loved them

review.reviewBody: I love these pants! Real to Size fit! Great material, breath well, dry fast, and resist water and stains

description: Buy the Black Diamond Sprint Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Sprint Short - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Sprint Short - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Pretty much the best running shorts on the face of the planet. Holds a large iPhone without bouncing all over the place. Really nice seams that dont chafe and plenty of room for gels and small foods. I regularly pack enough there with a hand water bottle to knock down 20 miles. The fabric dries quickly and doesnt get gross with odor.
review.name: Gold standard

review.reviewBody: The materials that these shorts are made of are nice. The fit leaves me scratching my head though. These shorts just dont look right. These shorts bunch up around the man parts which could be contributed by the side elastic pockets. Im not a fan.
review.name: The shorts fit weird

review.reviewBody: I am 5'8" 162 and the small fits just right, as long as I don't gain weight.  Quality short and the pockets come in handy for keys, ID, etc.  Would not hold a phone but who the hell needs one when you are punishing yourself?
review.name: My go-to PT shorts

review.reviewBody: BD isn't exactly known for their running gear, so I figured these were a gamble, but I like them a lot! I wouldn't say they are my go-to pair, but they're definitely in the rotation. Solid pockets, drawstring, liner. The material is a little "loud" compared to other shorts, can sound kind of crinkly. True to size. Overall-- very happy!
review.name: Pleasantly surprised!

review.reviewBody: I like the shorts, but my only issue with them is the liner is not comfortable. It really digs into the groin.
These have no front pockets and the back pocket is to small for my phone. Took a few weeks for me to get used to the built in underwear. I ordered a medium Im 57 and 165lbs and they seem to fit fine.
review.name: Not what I was expecting

review.reviewBody: These shorts arrived today and I could immediately tell something was wrong. The waistband of these shorts looked off and felt like the elasticity had already worn out. I tried them on and they look and feel like I put them on backwards, yet the drawstring is still in front so I know that I didnt. I know that ultra low rise jeans are all the rage, but the waist of my running shorts should at least be high enough to cover my pubes. Also, the pocket configuration is different than advertised and some of the labeling is different too. I feel like I was sold a prototype or a sales reps sample. These cant be what BD is selling to the public or no one would be wearing them.
review.name: Good ideas, terrible execution

review.reviewBody: These are phenomenally made running shorts, my only qualm is that a big selling point for me was the phone pocket. Alas, I think these were designed in the days before phones got to be the size they are now - still nice to have lots of little places to store things!
review.name: GREAT running shorts, but the phone pocket is a little small

review.reviewBody: I've been running mountain trails for 30 years and equipment keeps getting better. It's great that companies are putting useful pockets in shorts. I love Black Diamond equipment, but for skis, snow equipment, and mountain gear. They arrive on the running scene after making the best running poles, and make the best running short ever. The fabric is tough but not thick, they fit great, and they have functional pockets. They feel rugged like mountain running is.
review.name: Nailed it

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'2; 220# with a decent amount of leg and hip muscle and athletic build. I ordered a size large and these shorts just completely missed the mark on sizing. I have a few other BD pants in L that fit quite well. The waistband on these shorts have almost zero elastic quality, almost like an old worn out pair of shorts. The inner brief is very very tight for a size large, like uncomfortably tight. I even tried cutting out the brief which helped a little but then the shorts loose even more integrity at the waist band. Lastly they ride up in the front very quickly with any knee to chest movements (aka uphill running) and have to constantly be moved back down. I'm not sure if the smaller sizes fit smaller frames better but the size large fits a size large human very poorly.
review.name: Not made for thic bois

name: Sprint Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: Used it about 5 spring ski days so far. Best bang for the dollar I could find on the Internet machine. Two way pit zips, oversized adjustable hood, RFID pocket on sleeve, two way front zip for venting, soft chin insert to keep it snuggly out of the wind and great shell fabric . My only question about this anarack is who picked all the pink zippers which I'm starting to accept as a fashion statement?
review.name: Great features Great price

review.reviewBody: I've been using the anorak for over a month now and the only thing they got wrong was the design of the side pockets.  The storm flap faces forward.  I think it should face the back of the anorak.  Any type of snow or driving rain would have a tendency to enter under the storm flap and enter the pockets.  Plus, when you go to put your hands into the pocket you have to pull the flap back to get then into the pocket.  Your hands don't flow into the pockets.  Other than that, it's a nice product.
review.name: Stoic Shell Anorak

review.reviewBody: Im 5'9". I ordered a large, but this fits like XL. The sleeves go 4 " past my hands. And that hood could be used for a tent. Too bad the material is real nice. And the colors are cool. Workmanship is quality. Just sized wrong.
review.name: Hood? Or parachute?

review.reviewBody: Great minimalist design with just the right features for resort riding. No powder skirt or thumb holes but has everything else youd need. Pleasantly surprised with the quality compared to the price.
review.name: Stoic delivers

review.reviewBody:
Needed a nice jacket that both could keep me warm and be solid for learning snowboarding on the ice. After 5 trips and some heavy falls, it's holding up solid. The white part has stained a little, but that's with fine, and to be expected. 

The double zipper front pocket and underarm zips are perfect for days where your sweating on the lift. Highly recommend!
review.name: Awesome starter jacket!

review.reviewBody: Very pleased with this. I get extra 25% OFF Coupon from here: promo1024.com
review.name: Brilliant!

review.reviewBody:
This is a great anorak for someone wanting a comfy, lightweight, and less-intense jacket for resort riding. I bought this to wear when my gore-tex shell would be overkill, and before I could just ride in a big hoodie.

It has everything you need, and not much you don't. The fit is good, and the jacket is flexible, which is really important for a freeride snowboarder like me.

I do have one minor gripe, and that is that there is a zip only on the right side to fully open the jacket for warm days. This would be great for a normal-stance, but I'm goofy and when I unzip it while riding the whole jacket billows out and flaps around like a trash bag in the wind. I wish there was a zipper on the opposite side I could use.
review.name: good

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to like this good looking anorak, but the fit wasnt quite right. Oddly narrow at the bottom of the trunk. I might have tried a larger size if not for the unwieldy helmet sized hood that could house a small country. 

Maternal and construction was quality. I love the simple design. Backcountry quickly honored their return policy.
review.name: Great quality, peculiar fit

name: Shell Anorak - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this purity much bargain price I think ! Love it
review.name: Very convenient!

review.reviewBody: This coat replaces a much loved but no longer wearable Isis. My new Marmot doesnt have the decorative detail of the old jacket but I appreciate its zippered pockets, Velcroed sleeves and especially the extra high collar.
review.name: Great Replacement

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice, thin rain shell. The  color is perfect and the fit is exactly as expected.
review.name: Exactly what I ordered

review.reviewBody:
I wanted a color that would show up in the dark or overcast without being so bright that it looked like a garment for a child. I love the orange color & have rec'd many compliments on it.
The jacket is comfortable, & a good length, & the adjustable hood stays on well, without having to zip the jacket up all the way to the chin. 
My 2 disappointments in it are that instead of snaps on the placket covering the zipper, it has velcro which is a pain when the jacket is open or when hung & it touches other garments like a sweater, so I would have preferred snaps. The 2nd disappointment is that the nicely sized & zippered side pockets don't attach on the inside of the jacket so it looks as if you have additional inside pockets, but you do NOT; the fabric just runs through. ie: don't think you can insert your wallet or cellphone from the inside as it will just fall through! It would have been nice if those outer pockets had been sewn down on the bottom of the inside of the jacket to prevent this.
I haven't had the rain jacket long enough to judge its durability, but I am hoping for the best.
review.name: Almost exactly what I was looking for

review.reviewBody: Great rain/wind jacket.  I love the ability to tuck in the hood into the collar. This is my second one and I absolutely love the jacket.
review.name: Fantastic jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable and protective! Highly recommend
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the jacket, but would like it better if it had a more substantial zipper.
review.name: Great jacket for rainy days

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent lightweight rain jacket. True to size. Great coverage over the behind. Works great as a wind breaker too!
review.name: All weather worth

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Light weight, attractive fit, and trustworthy to stand up to any weather
review.name: Sweet Rain Shell

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] perfect rain jacket -- well made, well thought out for comfort and function - expect it to last for many years.
review.name: Great Rain jacket!

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
Lightweight and minimalist
Good length
Fast drying
Comfortable

Cons
I little wider in the legs than I would have hoped.
Because of the minimal nature I have trouble with the waist band rolling over
Ultra minimal adjustment straps are difficult to get tight enough.
Pretty high waisted, which puts the tiny fly ay an unusable height.

Overall good shorts and pretty high in my rotation with some fit and execution issues
review.name: Pretty Decent Shorts, but...

review.reviewBody: My husband loves these pants. They have a slim-ish cut for his frame (athletic) and are long enough to overlap with knee pads, and not leave that awkward gap. They're lightweight, and ideal for hot summer riding. They have a side pocket down your leg, but isn't a typical pocket setup. The internal belt system is a little fiddly, but not too hard to adjust. Overall, he loves them!
review.name: Lightweight and long

hasVariant.description: Buy the Montane Fireball Lite Hooded Jacket - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I originally bought the Fireball Lite as my ski midlayer to wear under my shell or for touring and have found myself reaching for it all year long for hiking, chillier runs etc.  It's incredibly breathable when you start to work up a sweat but keeps me warm without a lot of bulk in my layering system. There is also a PFAS-free DWR treatment so it gives me some extra protection from any random bouts of snow/rain without immediately needing to throw on a hard shell.

It has a great feel and fits snugly, but not too tight which is flattering and the stretch doesn't limit any motion. Super comfy - I feel like I come home and sometimes forget to take it off. Super versatile and would definitely recommend!
review.name: Perfect active insulation!

name: Fireball Lite Hooded Jacket - Women's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Fitzroy Tent: 3-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fitzroy Tent: 3-Person 4-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Fitzroy Tent: 3-Person 4-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is my second Fitzroy tent. It is bombproof in extreme weather and reasonably light weight for a 4-season shelter. The four pole design is easy to set up in high wind. It ensures the tent doesn't flap or cave in with gusts. I liked that the old design had a front and back vestibule built in, will see if this stripped down new design performs as well. While single wall tents aren't super breathable, the front and back door mesh allows for sufficient airflow.
review.name: bombproof

review.reviewBody: I've used this in the Alaska Range and found it to be exceptionally comfortable, durable, warm, and dry. Even though it is single-walled, the fabric wicks away moisture efficiently and keeps the interior dry.  It is heavier than other tents, so it is less than ideal for fast alpine ascents, but for base camp or higher established camps it can't be beat.
review.name: Incredible expedition tent

name: Fitzroy Tent: 3-Person 4-Season

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Just got this set and used all of it during my November, 2023 winter camping event.

It's very compact. Easy to clean.

!! Be very careful to keep flames from going outside of the metal base. Worked well on my JetBoil propane burners.

Hoping to use on the stovetop of my Winnerwell camp stove for my December 2023 winter camping event in a few weeks.

Happy that the Sea To Summit 10 Liter water cells did not leak on this November trip.
review.name: Great, compact & very useful !!!

review.reviewBody: I finally vowed to try and downsize my pack size to make trips more comfortable. This set to save on space in my pack was huge in achieving that! I do still carry a bit of aluminum to wrap around the base of the stove and put under the lid if it is windy/cold and I have to boil a full pot. Silicone doesn't conduct heat as well as metal so the boil time is a bit slower. But 1 cup of water still boils in about a minute.
review.name: Game changer

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I truly enjoy that the set is compact and fun to use
review.name: Amazing product

review.reviewBody: I purchased this product based on a recommendation and I was super happy with what I got. It didn't fit my needs, so I returned it hassle free, but if you plan to have a controlled fire and need a super packable pot that includes a cup and bowl, look no further!
review.name: This is what you need

review.reviewBody: Havent used it yet, but excited to once the backpacking starts !
review.name: Looks great

review.reviewBody: This pot works very well and the collapsible nature of the set makes for a light and easy packing for backcountry trips (both the pot and the cookware collapse into flat discs). I've used this pot on many trips and it does the job well. I gave the product a 4 star instead of a 5-star rating because after nearly 3 years of use the silicone peeled away on one side. I feel that a product such as this should last a minimum of 5 years and ideally longer to reduce waste production. However, when I emailed Sea to Summit about repair and warranty, they reviewed my comments and will send me a new pot. I am very impressed with the high level of customer service. I was advised about how best to use the pot to avoid future peeling of the silicone and while I thought I had been using the pot correctly, I will bear the advice in mind and hopefully, this set will last me many more seasons!
review.name: Convenient, easy to use cookware set and exceptional customer service - thanks Sea to Summit!

review.reviewBody: a group of 6 of us went motorcycle traveling. 4 of us had this pot/bowl set. All 4 lids cracked within a couple weeks. Otherwise totally awesome but the lids need improvements.
review.name: great, but the lids crack easily

review.reviewBody:
Needed new backpacking cookset. Saw good reviews.
Excellent lightweight cook/dining set. All you really need at only 14 oz.
review.name: Great for Backpacking

review.reviewBody: I bought this for bike packing, as well as camping and backpacking. I've use the set a handful of times now and really like it. Super compact and easy to clean. I did have a spill while draining pasta water, but I think it had to do with user error, to be honest. I pressed down too hard on lid, wanting to ensure that it wouldn't slide/pop off ... and then the pot collapsed like an accordion. Since that time, with 4 more uses, I haven't had that happen.
review.name: Bike Packing

review.reviewBody:
Hey Backcountry!  I'm 5'10" with a fairly long torso & short legs. The 7 inch inseam fit me really well.  Please bring it back! I ride multiple days a week and i'm constantly digging through my laundry for my shorts. I want to buy more!

I mainly ride cross country, and I don't wear knee pads. I don't like fabric pulling on my knees when i'm cycling.  

Not all MTB riders are hitting the chairlifts, yet the entire industry is putting out 9-12 inch inseams, meant to ride with kneepads, which only caters to one style of rider. Please be the outlier and capture the business of people needing shorter inseams and more interested in the long climbs and epic rides than the jumps and drops.
review.name: missing my 7inch inseam

review.reviewBody: You can't get it unless you are an XL or XXL. I bought my size small in the spring and went back later to get another pair in a different color, but they were out. I have been waiting for a restock for about four months. It is a great short. I bought the green one, and I want to purchase the Bistre. I hope someday they restock.
review.name: It's a great short, BUT...

review.reviewBody: These are really a great pair of shorts. They are light, stretchy, and fashionable. They are noticeably more stretchy and lighter than the Zoic shorts I've been wearing for the past year. Definitely would recommend
review.name: My new go-to short

review.reviewBody:
These are my most favourite shorts. I have the 7" version (please bring them back!). 

I've tried so many competitor brands, not necessarily bike specific but I cannot find something that fits and feels as good as these shorts. I use them for all kinds of sports now because they are so much lighter than normal sports shorts, but really durable.

The 7" versions fit like normal shorts, so you can wear them casually too and they look really nice.
review.name: Amazing all round shorts (7inch version)

review.reviewBody: These are great shorts and something I have been looking for since I am short and tired of the 13 inch length shorts out there. I am 5' 6" with a 30.5 inch inseam and these sit above my knee. So far they have been great on my rides. Really comfortable, and have been resistant to tears on some brambly trails. I like the waist adjustability, that should last a lot longer than the velcro options out there. Pockets are good for a phone, and I like the vents on the inside of the legs. I would be even happier if they had one pocket in the back but I will take what I can get in this size/length.
review.name: Finally something for short people!

review.reviewBody: I'm happy with my purchase, the fit is great, and I could wear the shorts even if not for mountain biking. They're so comfortable and breathable.
review.name: Great MTB/Casual shorts

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts for mountain biking.  The pockets in the front zip close so you can store your car keys without fearing loss.  The waist clip is infinitely adjustable so you can get the best fit.  Also, the fabric survives crashes, to which I can attest.  I have had them for two years and the still look new.
review.name: Best riding short!

review.reviewBody: I've used these a few times now and am quite happy with the shorts.  I'm not a fan of long, really baggy shorts so these fit the bill perfect for me.  Stretchy enough to be comfortable, but not so stretchy that they snag on the saddle.  I really like the integrated belt on them too.  The Aspen Green color is fantastic!
review.name: Great shorts

review.reviewBody: I have purchased a few of these and they are awesome. Well made with quality materials, great feel and fit. More importantly, they fit just right, not too tight and not too loose for my preference. These pants were earlier in the $40 to $50 range, however, they are $100 now. That would be my only mark against these bike shorts.
review.name: The Perfect bike pants

review.reviewBody: I am 5'10", 150 lbs, size 31" waist and the Small size fit well. Shorts are very comfortable and seem to be well made. I like the way the belt works. Would recommend.
review.name: Comfortable Shorts

hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit KSB 20 Down Sleeping Bag: 20F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Haven't used it overnight yet but the fit is comfortable and the material seems of good quality.

This is a great sleeping bag! Very warm & comfortable. It works great for sleeping in the back of your SUV or truck or even in a tent near your car. However, it is definitely not for hiking. It is very light weight, but very bulky & doesnt compact down well at all. Takes up a ton of room. So it is great for camping near your car, but not for hiking. I would definitely choose a different one for hiking.
review.name: Great! But bulky

review.reviewBody: Because we took this bag backpacking and our 2 kids said it was lightweight in their backpacks and warm at night. Win win! Downside? Doesnt go too low for colder temperatures. But the down combo was the overall winnereven the one who gets cold at night said it was wonderful. The drawstring around the head is perfect. Packs pretty small as well. We hiked a few miles and no one complained about the weight.
review.name: Lightweight and warm!

review.reviewBody: This bag is so comfortable. Its a great bag for car or backpack camping. Stuffs pretty small and is so comfortable!  It shortens up for my son 51 very well. This is my first cocoon sleeping bag so take with a grain of salt.
review.name: So Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Big and spacious. Temps only got down to 40s so I had to unzip a bit, definitely warm and large.
review.name: Warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I love this bag. Roomy, warm, comfortable, and not too heavy.
review.name: I love this bag. Roomy,

review.reviewBody: With temperatures dipping into the upper 20s a few nights and mostly in the lower 30s I stayed very warm in this bag. Additionally, this bag packs down much smaller than some of my other 20 and 30  bags which made it ideal for a backpack hunting trip I would highly recommend this as a good option.
review.name: Cozy

review.reviewBody: Bought this for a bike packing trip. Very light and comfortable to sleep in.  Temp was in low 40s in mountain environment but sleeping back kept very warm. Packed up and compressed the bag was a little bigger than I hoped making it difficult to store on bike. Good quality and price.
review.name: Bike packing

review.reviewBody: For the price it is a great buy and was used twice for camping trips so far. It has a very comfortable feel unlike most of the bags I have used making it much more compatible to get in with shorts and a t-shirt. It definitely ways heavier, but packs down to a good size. Have not had any water touch it yet and am concerned it would become saturated very fast if hiking in wet conditions for a few days. Also very warm, did a 45-degree night and made me start sweating instantly. I do run warm.
review.name: New Bag

review.reviewBody: I felt like sleeping in this bag when at home in bed! Most comfortable bag Ive owned.
review.name: Best bag Ive owned.

review.reviewBody: Perfect day pack, fit all the necessities plus a little bit more.  Stayed nice and ventilated on my back even on a shade-less 90F hike
review.name: Couldnt be happier!

review.reviewBody: Picked up this bag for day hikes to use in place of an older, larger pack. It is a great size if you don't need to pack lots of layers. You can fit an extra shirt, socks, and 1-2 small jackets or a pair of binoculars, plus some small goodies. If you need a lot of room for snacks and gear, I would choose a bigger pack. The 3-liter water pouch is included, and in my opinion, it is the best and easiest to use of 3 brands of which I own water packs. The pouch has its own hanger and the opening is easy to work with. Use and setup is intuitive.  I wish they included the bite valve cover, (because why would you not want one?), but you can purchase one separately. I am 5'-9" (and 170 lbs), so on the taller side for women, and this fit just fine. There is probably a even bit of adjustment remaining for someone an inch or so taller. It was quite comfortable with nearly all 3 liters of water and my gear. The side pouches are big enough to fit a smart phone, as long as it's not a big one. Mine fit just fine and was great for accessibility for taking photos. The pack holds this bag off your lower back so there is room to breathe. The straps were secure. My only gripe is I did not see any rain fly for this pack. That should be included at this price point. Otherwise, I highly recommend it for day hikes with minimal gear required.
review.name: Great pack for day hikes with minimal gear

review.reviewBody: The Juno24 h2o is my favorite pack, I wanted something smaller for short day hikes. I tried a bunch of other small packs, and none compared to the Juno. Until I found the Sula16, if youre looking for a smaller Juno pack, this one is it.
review.name: Smaller version of my favorite pack, Juno24 h2o!

review.reviewBody: I LOVE this pack!  It fits my body perfectly (I'm 5'11), has a ton of pockets, and is extremely comfortable to wear.  It's sturdy and holds up well.  Great pack!
review.name: Pack

review.reviewBody: I love this as a daypack. All of my packs I own are Gregory Packs. I don't buy any other brand. I like their Nylon exterior, hip belts and pocket designs. Their day packs are normally too short for me. I am only 5'5" but I have a long torso so I need a day pack longer than their standard 19" torso length. They finally made one that goes up to 21" torso length so I bought it. It fits perfect and the waist belt fits around my hips where it belongs. I also like the new frame and ventilation system to prevent by back from getting too sweaty. I haven't used it yet, but I have an older Jade 38 model that I love and I know based on the fit and functionality of this daypack, it will be great. I am so excited to finally get a daypack that fits and has a ventilation system. Awesome!

review.reviewBody: I would say this chalk bag is nice quality and it looks nice. The only issue I have with it is that it is a bit small compared to other bags on the market. If you have big hands I would possibly buy a different bag.
review.name: Pretty Ok- Gets the  job done

review.reviewBody: Compact, comfy interior, and color matches other Mammut clothes. Looks durable, but will update if there's any defects.
review.name: Capable and stylish

review.reviewBody: Reasonably priced and great quality chalk bag, does everything you need it to with serveral attachment options
review.name: Ophir chalk bag

review.reviewBody: Have used this chalk bag multiple, multiple times with no issues! Durable and worthy this bag really can take a beating and still hold up. I highly recommend this for any level of climber beginner to expert. And for the price you get amazing quality that will hold up for years and years. Highly recommend for anyone.
review.name: Excellent gear!

review.reviewBody: It's a great beginner chalk bag, and I really liked how an attachment point was sewn into the bag to make it easier to attach to a harness. Unfortunately, that attachment piece ripped right off. Which is why I'm giving it a 4 stars.
review.name: Great Beginner Chalk Bag

review.reviewBody: Nice bag secures to harness nicely and closure is tight enough to keep the chalk in while not in use.

Its a solid chalk bag. It's nice and light weight which makes it barely noticeable. Since it's not as deep as some other chalk bags, it makes grabbing chalk very accessible. The brush holder on the side makes a nice addition to the bag.
If you have larger hands this bag is a little more difficult to access.

The one thing that sets this apart from other chalk bags is the fact that it can be attached directly to the Ophir harness via a small sewn piece. Unfortunately, this piece broke off on my second use.
Definitely a smaller opening on this bag. It works well for me becuase I have smaller hands. Has a loop for easily connecting to my Mammut Ophir harness.
review.name: Great Chalk bag

name: Ophir Chalk Bag
